title: Bug 13725 - Revert is slower than close and reopen in Java Editor
description: When performing the steps to revert a file in the Java Editor, it takes significantly longer compared to closing and reopening the file.
OB: After selecting 'Revert' from the popup menu in the editor, it takes approximately 15 seconds for the contents of the window to be replaced with the original.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1) Open the editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository. 2) Make a change, such as adding a space character to mark the file as dirty. 3) Close the editor by clicking on the close box in the editor tab. When prompted to save changes, select 'No'. 4) Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. Observe the time it takes for the file to open. 5) Repeat steps 1) and 2) to mark the file as dirty again. 6) Right-click inside the editor and select 'Revert' from the popup menu. Observe the time it takes for the contents of the window to be replaced with the original.
